alert.note: Alert for Southern Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 08 at 2:02PM EST until January 09 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Chesterfield, Northern Lancaster and Southern Lancaster. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A strong low pressure system will move through the area Tuesday producing heavy rain at times with rainfall totals between 2 and 3 inches. With this area experiencing the most rain in the past 30 days, conditions may be more favorable for flash flooding, especially in poor drainage areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
